info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 3:19PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Fulton and central Montgomery Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 318 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ephratah, or near Fonda, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gloversville, Johnstown, Canajoharie, Fonda, Berkshire, Palatine Bridge, Meco, Marshville, Cook Corners, Sprakers, Sammonsville, Broadalbin Junction, Hale Mills, McKinley, East Stone Arabia, Eppie Corners, West Bush, Smiths Corners, Progress and Cork. This includes Interstate 90 near exit 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
